item.title: 工会致会员的备忘录：空中客车公司在采取施压策略后改变了 A220 工人谈判的基调
item.description: 根据路透社周二看到的一份发给工会成员的备忘录，在开始采取减缓生产的施压策略后，空中客车公司改变了与蒙特利尔地区 A220 喷气式飞机装配工人谈判的基调。【原文：Airbus has changed its tone in bargaining with Montreal-area A220 jet assembly workers following the start of pressure tactics to slow production, according to a union memo to members on Tuesday seen by Reuters.】

item.title: Kering 警告称第一季度收入下降 10%，Gucci 领跌
item.description: 奢侈品集团开云集团（Kering）周二警告称，受明星品牌古驰（Gucci）的拖累，其第一季度销售额可能下降约 10%，使人们对该集团遏制了销售下滑的希望破灭。【原文：Luxury goods group Kering warned on Tuesday that its first-quarter sales are likely to drop by around 10%, weighed down by star label Gucci, knocking back hopes that it had stemmed sales declines.】

item.title: 得克萨斯州学校基金因贝莱德的 ESG 政策从其撤资 85 亿美元
item.description: 德克萨斯州的一家学校基金周二表示，由于全球最大资产管理公司贝莱德的能源投资政策，它将终止管理该州约 85 亿美元资金的合同。【原文：A Texas schools fund said it told BlackRock on Tuesday it would terminate a contract to manage around $8.5 billion of state money due to the energy investment policies of the world's largest asset manager.】

item.title: 科诺科公司总裁表示，美国石油产量将超过 1,400 万桶/日，然后趋于稳定
item.description: 康菲石油公司（ConocoPhillips）首席执行官瑞安-兰斯（Ryan Lance）周二预测，美国石油日产量将增长到超过 1400 万桶，然后趋于平稳。【原文：U.S. oil production will grow to exceed 14 million barrels per day and then plateau, ConocoPhillips CEO Ryan Lance forecast on Tuesday.】

item.title: 微软聘请 DeepMind 联合创始人苏莱曼领导新的消费人工智能组织
item.description: 微软周二表示，已聘请 Alphabet 旗下 DeepMind 公司的联合创始人穆斯塔法-苏莱曼（Mustafa Suleyman）担任新成立的微软人工智能公司（Microsoft AI）的负责人，主要负责推进 Copilot 及其他消费类人工智能产品的发展。【原文：Microsoft has hired the co-founder of Alphabet's DeepMind, Mustafa Suleyman, to head its newly formed organization called Microsoft AI, focused on advancing Copilot and its other consumer AI products, the tech giant said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 独家报道波音防务供应商2023年按时交付80%的产品 供应链受阻
item.description: 根据路透社看到的波音公司的衡量标准和公司介绍，波音公司的国防、太空和安全供应商在 2023 年的准时交货情况有所改善，但仍低于令人满意的衡量标准。【原文：Boeing's defense, space and security suppliers improved their on-time deliveries in 2023, but still fell below a measurement for satisfactory performance, according to metrics and a presentation from the company seen by Reuters.】

item.title: 备忘录显示，摩根大通成立了专门的体育投资银行团队
item.description: 据路透社周二看到的一份内部备忘录显示，摩根大通已经成立了一个新的专注于体育的投资银行团队，这家华尔街银行正试图开发这个日益具有吸引力的行业。【原文：JPMorgan Chase has created a new sports-focused investment banking team as the Wall Street bank seeks to tap the increasingly attractive industry, according to an internal memo seen by Reuters on Tuesday.】

item.title: 麦当劳首席执行官肯普金斯基将担任董事会主席一职
item.description: 麦当劳周二表示，在恩里克-埃尔南德斯（Enrique Hernandez）退休后，首席执行官克里斯-肯普辛斯基（Chris Kempczinski）将兼任董事长一职。【原文：McDonald's said on Tuesday CEO Chris Kempczinski will take on an additional role as chairman of the board after the retirement of Enrique Hernandez.】

item.title: 美国商品期货交易委员会对美国银行和奥本海默因记录保存失误处以罚款
item.description: 美国商品期货交易委员会（U.S. Bank NA）和奥本海默公司（Oppenheimer & Co）周二表示，已同意支付罚款，以了结美国商品期货交易委员会关于使用未经批准的通信渠道的指控。【原文：U.S. Bank NA and Oppenheimer & Co have agreed to pay fines to settle charges from the U.S. Commodity Futures Trading Commision over use of unapproved communications channels, the regulator said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 据 CNBC 报道，英伟达新型人工智能芯片售价将超过 3 万美元
item.description: 芯片设计公司英伟达（Nvidia）首席执行官黄仁勋周二告诉CNBC，英伟达最新的 "Blackwell "B200人工智能芯片售价将在3万至4万美元之间。【原文：Chip designer Nvidia's latest "Blackwell" B200 artificial intelligence chip will cost between $30,000 and$40,000, CEO Jensen Huang told CNBC on Tuesday.】

item.title: 聚焦：绿色能源巨头挪威国家电力公司（Statkraft）寻求挪威以外的发展
item.description: 挪威国有公用事业公司斯塔特克拉夫特（Statkraft）已悄然成为欧洲最大的可再生能源生产商，在新任首席执行官的领导下，该公司面临的挑战是如何在全球增长的雄心与财务约束和上市呼声之间取得平衡。【原文：Norwegian state-owned utility Statkraft, which has quietly become Europe's largest renewable energy producer, faces the challenge under its new CEO of balancing ambitions for global growth with financial restraint and calls to go public.】

item.title: 加拿大大型银行表示，可持续融资承诺可能不会抑制排放增长
item.description: 加拿大一些最大的银行首次承认，它们与气候相关的融资努力不一定会抑制排放的增长。此前，气候活动人士多年来一直施压，要求银行在有关气候目标的主张方面更加透明。【原文：Some of Canada's biggest banks have admitted for the first time that their climate-related finance efforts may not necessarily curtail emissions growth, following years of pressure from climate activists for banks to be more transparent about their claims on climate goals.】

item.title: ATC Telecom 寻求将价值 1.74 亿美元的印度沃达丰 Idea 公司的债券转换为股票
item.description: 印度电信运营商沃达丰 Idea Ltd 周二表示，American Tower Corp (ATC) Telecom Infrastructure 已要求将价值 144 亿卢比（1.735 亿美元）的债券转换为股票。【原文：Indian telecom operator Vodafone Idea Ltd said on Tuesday American Tower Corp (ATC) Telecom Infrastructure has requested conversion of debentures worth 14.4 billion rupees ($173.5 million) into equity shares.】

item.title: 美国改变电动汽车里程规定，汽车制造商获胜
item.description: 根据本周二发布的最终规定，汽车制造商在制造电动汽车以满足美国燃油经济性规定时，将获得比监管机构最初建议更多的优惠。【原文：Automakers will get significantly more credit for building electric vehicles in meeting U.S. fuel economy rules, than regulators initially proposed, under final rules released Tuesday.】

item.title: SpaceX 称计划商业化销售卫星激光链路
item.description: 太空探索技术公司总裁格温-肖特维尔（Gwynne Shotwell）在周二的一次会议上表示，该公司已开始向其他卫星公司出售用于快速空间通信的卫星激光器。【原文：SpaceX has started selling satellite lasers, which are used for speedy in-space communications, to other satellite firms, the company’s president Gwynne Shotwell said at a conference on Tuesday.】

item.title: 购买比特币的可转换交易后，微策略公司股价下跌 13
item.description: 周二，微策略公司（MicroStrategy）股价下跌 13%，原因是该公司宣布已完成 6.0375 亿美元的可转债发行（一周内第二次发行），以筹集资金购买比特币。【原文：Shares in MicroStrategy were down 13% on Tuesday as bitcoin fell after the company announced it had completed a $603.75 million convertible debt offering - its second in a week - to raise money to buy bitcoin.】

item.title: 法拉利因刹车缺陷被美国车手起诉
item.description: 法拉利在美国被一些驾驶员起诉，称这家意大利豪华跑车制造商未能修复可能部分或完全丧失制动能力的车辆。【原文：Ferrari has been sued in the United States by drivers who said the Italian luxury sports car maker has failed to fix vehicles at risk of a partial or total loss of braking capability.】

item.title: 破产的加密货币贷款机构 Genesis 将支付 2,100 万美元，以了结美国证券交易委员会的指控
item.description: 美国证券交易委员会（U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission）周二表示，Genesis Global Capital LLC 已同意支付 2100 万美元的民事罚款，以了结该公司在未注册的情况下通过其加密借贷项目非法出售证券的指控。【原文：Genesis Global Capital LLC has agreed to pay a $21 million civil fine to settle charges that it illegally sold securities through its crypto lending program without registering them, the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 高盛数字资产主管称散户投资者推动加密货币上涨
item.description: 高盛（Goldman Sachs）数字资产主管马修-麦克德莫特（Mathew McDermott）周二表示，近期加密货币价格的飙升主要是由散户投资者推动的，但机构也开始加入其中。【原文：The recent surge in cryptocurrency prices has been driven by retail investors, but institutions are starting to join in, Goldman Sachs' head of digital assets Mathew McDermott said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 首席财务官发表黯淡前景展望后，西门子股价跌至一年新低
item.description: 周二，西门子财务总监拉尔夫-托马斯（Ralf Thomas）在美国银行（Bank of America）的一次会议上表示，其旗舰数字工业部门第二季度的收入将持平，此后西门子股价跌至一年来的最低点。【原文：Shares in Siemens slumped to their lowest in one year after its finance chief Ralf Thomas commented that revenues at its flagship digital industries division will be flat in the second quarter at a Bank of America conference on Tuesday.】

item.title: 独家消息消息人士称，诺德斯特龙创始家族正在争取将美国零售商私有化
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士周二表示，诺德斯特龙公司（Nordstrom Inc）背后的创始家族正在寻求将这家美国百货商店运营商私有化，六年前曾有过类似的尝试，但未获成功。【原文：The founding family behind Nordstrom Inc is seeking to take the U.S. department store operator private, six years after a similar attempt proved unsuccessful, people familiar with the matter said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 美国法官批评美国证券交易委员会在与区块链公司的纠纷中 "严重滥用 "权力
item.description: 一名美国联邦法官称，美国证券交易委员会（SEC）在与区块链技术公司 Digital Licensing（该公司以 DEBT Box 的名义开展业务）的纠纷中 "严重滥用了国会赋予它的权力"。【原文：A U.S. federal judge said the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) had engaged in "gross abuse of the power entrusted to it by Congress" in its dispute with blockchain technology firm Digital Licensing, which does business as DEBT Box.】

item.title: 负利率时代不可能很快重现
item.description: 在欧洲结束长达十年的负利率实验 18 个月后，日本央行也结束了长达十年的负利率实验，17 年来首次加息。这标志着一个时代的终结，很少有人希望它再次出现。【原文：Eighteen months after Europe ended its decade-long experiment with negative interest rates, the Bank of Japan has done the same with its first rate hike in 17 years. It marks the end of an era few expect to see again.】

item.title: 会计机构称投资者希望获得被美国规则排除在外的气候数据
item.description: 国际可持续发展标准委员会（ISSB）主席告诉路透社，投资者将要求公司提供间接温室气体排放的数据，而美国新的财务披露规则将这些数据排除在外。【原文：Investors will be asking companies for data on indirect greenhouse gas emissions that new U.S. financial disclosure rules exclude, the International Sustainability Standards Board's (ISSB) chair told Reuters.】

item.title: 美国 2 月独户住宅开工率飙升
item.description: 由于气温温和，市场上的二手房持续短缺，2 月份美国单户住宅建设大幅反弹。【原文：U.S. single-family homebuilding rebounded sharply in February amid mild temperatures and a persistent shortage of previously owned houses on the market.】

item.title: Facebook 联合创始人萨韦林的 B Capital 新机会基金融资 7.5 亿美元
item.description: 由 Facebook 联合创始人爱德华多-萨韦林（Eduardo Saverin）共同创立的全球投资公司 B Capital 周二宣布，其第二支机会基金（Opportunities Fund）已完成募资，募资总额达 7.5 亿美元，该基金将投资于处于后期阶段的初创企业。【原文：Global investment firm B Capital, co-founded by Facebook co-founder Eduardo Saverin, on Tuesday announced the close of its second Opportunities Fund with total fundraising of $750 million as it bets on investments in late-stage startups.】

item.title: 加拿大 2 月份通胀率意外降至 2.8
item.description: 周二的数据显示，加拿大2月份的年通胀率意外降至2.8%，为6月份以来的最慢速度，核心通胀指标也降至两年多来的低点，从而提高了年中降息的预期。【原文：Canada's annual inflation rate in February unexpectedly cooled to 2.8%, its slowest pace since June, and core inflation measures eased to more-than two-year lows, data showed on Tuesday, raising expectations of a mid-year rate cut.】

item.title: 据 CNBC 报道，乔治-卢卡斯在与尼尔森-佩尔茨的代理权争夺战中支持迪士尼首席执行官艾格
item.description: 据 CNBC 周二报道，电影制片人乔治-卢卡斯（George Lucas）在华特迪士尼首席执行官鲍勃-艾格（Bob Iger）与激进投资者纳尔逊-佩尔茨（Nelson Peltz）激烈的代理权争夺战中支持迪士尼。【原文：Filmmaker George Lucas has backed Walt Disney CEO Bob Iger in the media company's bitter proxy battle with activist investor Nelson Peltz, CNBC reported on Tuesday.】

item.title: 对冲基金撼动欧元区 10 万亿美元政府债券市场
item.description: 对冲基金正纷纷涌入欧元区 10 万亿美元的政府债券市场，在资金需求激增和欧洲央行退缩之际寻找机会。【原文：Hedge funds are piling into the euro zone's $10 trillion government bond market, scenting opportunities as funding needs surge and the European Central Bank retreats.】

item.title: 超微股价下跌，AI 服务器制造商寻求通过出售股权融资 20 亿美元
item.description: 超微计算机公司（Super Micro Computer）周二披露，它将出售 200 万股股票，价格可能达到约 20 亿美元，这使得这家人工智能（AI）服务器制造商的股价在盘前交易中下跌了 9%。【原文：Super Micro Computer disclosed on Tuesday it will sell 2 million shares that could fetch about $2 billion, sending the artificial intelligence (AI) server maker's shares 9% lower in trading before the bell.】
